  • Method Details

    • actorExists

      public boolean actorExists​(String actorId)
      This method checks if the actor corresponding to the given actorId exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      actorId - The actorId corresponding to the actor being checked.
      Returns:
      Return true if the actor exist, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      addActor(String) in NEO4jDAO for example usage

    • addActor

      public int addActor​(String name, String actorId)
      This endpoint is to add an actor node into the database. If an actor with the same actorId already exists in the database, no node is added.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the actor being added.
      actorId - The actorId of the actor being added.
      Returns:
      Return 200 if the actor was successfully added, 400 if the request body is improperly formatted, missing required information, or an actor with the same actorId already exists, and 500 if save or add was unsuccessful (Java Exception Thrown).
      See Also:
      actorExists(String)

    • movieExists

      public boolean movieExists​(String movieId)
      This method checks if the movie corresponding to the given movieId exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      movieId - The movieId corresponding to the movie being checked.
      Returns:
      Return true if the movie exist, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      addMovie(String) in NEO4jDAO for example usage

    • addMovie

      public int addMovie​(String name, String movieId)
      This endpoint is to add a movie node into the database. If a movie with the same movieId already exists in the database, no node is added.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the movie being added.
      movieId - The movieId of the movie being added.
      Returns:
      Return 200 if the movie was successfully added, 400 if the request body is improperly formatted, missing required information, or a movie with the same movieId already exists, and 500 if save or add was unsuccessful (Java Exception Thrown).
      See Also:
      movieExists(String)

    • relationshipExists

      public boolean relationshipExists​(String actorId, String movieId)
      This method checks if an ACTED_IN relationship between the given actor and movie exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      actorId - The actorId corresponding to the actor being checked.
      movieId - The movieId corresponding to the movie being checked.
      Returns:
      Return true if the relationship exists, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      addRelationship(String) in NEO4jDAO for example usage

    • addRelationship

      public int addRelationship​(String actorId, String movieId)
      This endpoint is to add an ACTED_IN relationship between an actor and a movie in the database. If an ACTED_IN relationship between the actor and movie already exists in the database, no relationship is added. If the actor or movie does not exist in the database, no relationship is added.
      Parameters:
      actorId - The actorId of the actor in question.
      movieId - The movieId of the movie in question.
      Returns:
      Return 200 if the relationship was successfully added, 400 if the request body is improperly formatted, missing required information, or a relationship with the same relationshipId already exists, 404 if the actor or movie does not exist, and 500 if save or add was unsuccessful (Java Exception Thrown).
      See Also:
      relationshipExists(String, String)

    • getActor

      public String getActor​(String actorId)
      This endpoint is to check if an actor exists in the database. If the actor does not exist in the database, or an internal server error occurs, a string containing response code is returned. Otherwise, a string containing the response body JSONObject is returned.

      Response body string format example:

      { "actorId": "nm1111891", "name": "John Doe", "movies": ["nm8911231", "nm1991341", "nm2005431"]}

      Parameters:
      actorId - The actorId of the actor in question.
      Returns:
      Return a string containing the response body JSONObject if the relationship was successfully added, "404" if the actor or movie does not exist, and "500" if save or add was unsuccessful (Java Exception Thrown).
      See Also:
      getActor(HttpExchange) in ReqHandler for example usage

    • getMovie

      public String getMovie​(String movieId)
      This endpoint is to check if a movie exists in the database. If the movie does not exist in the database, or an internal server error occurs, a string containing response code is returned. Otherwise, a string containing the response body JSONObject is returned.

      Response body string format example:

      { "movieId": "nm1111891", "name": "Groundhog Day", "actors": ["nm8911231", "nm1991341", "nm2005431"]}

      Parameters:
      movieId - The movieId of the actor in question.
      Returns:
      Return a string containing the response body JSONObject if the query was successful, "404" if the movie does not exist, and "500" if save or add was unsuccessful (Java Exception Thrown).
      See Also:
      getMovie(HttpExchange) in ReqHandler for example usage

    • hasRelationship

      public String hasRelationship​(String actorId, String movieId)
      This endpoint is to check if a relationship between an actor and a movie exists in the database. If the relationship does not exist in the database, or an internal server error occurs, a string containing response code is returned. Otherwise, a string containing the response body JSONObject is returned.

      Response body string format example:

      { "actorId": "nm1111891", "movieId": "nm234923", "hasRelationship": false }

      Parameters:
      actorId - The actorId of the actor in question.
      movieId - The movieId of the movie in question.
      Returns:
      Return a string containing the response body JSONObject if the query was successful, "404" if the actor or movie does not exist, and "500" if save or add was unsuccessful (Java Exception Thrown).
      See Also:
      hasRelationship(HttpExchange) in ReqHandler for example usage

    • computeBaconNumber

      public String computeBaconNumber​(String actorId)
      This endpoint is to check the bacon number of an actor. If the path does not exist in the database, or an internal server error occurs, a string containing response code is returned. Otherwise, a string containing the response body JSONObject is returned. If the actor is Kevin Bacon, the baconNumber is 0.

      Response body string format example:

      { "baconNumber": 3 }

      Parameters:
      actorId - The actorId of the actor in question.
      Returns:
      Return a string containing the response body JSONObject if the query was successful, "404" if the actor or a path to Kevin Bacon does not exist, and "500" if save or add was unsuccessful (Java Exception Thrown).
      See Also:
      computeBaconNumber(HttpExchange) in ReqHandler for example usage

    • computeBaconPath

      public String computeBaconPath​(String actorId)
      This endpoint returns the shortest Bacon Path in order from the actor given to Kevin Bacon. If the actor or path does not exist in the database, or an internal server error occurs, a string containing response code is returned. Otherwise, a string containing the response body JSONObject is returned. If the actor is Kevin Bacon, the list of interchanging actors and movies is just Kevin Bacon's id.

      Response body string format example:

      { "baconPath": [ "nm1991271", "nm9112231", "nm9191136", "nm9894331", "nm0000102" ] }

      Parameters:
      actorId - The actorId of the actor in question.
      Returns:
      Return a string containing the response body JSONObject of with a list of interchanging actors and movies beginning with the inputted actorId and ending with Kevin Baconâ€™s actorId if the query was successful, "404" if the actor or a path to Kevin Bacon does not exist, and "500" if save or add was unsuccessful (Java Exception Thrown).
      See Also:
      computeBaconPath(HttpExchange) in ReqHandler for example usage
